results.abstract: Plays with science fiction themes and stories have become a growing trend with playwrights; photos (M)

headline.main: Cyborgs Onstage, Robots in the Wings

results.snippet: Science fiction, long the province of films and novels, has been turning up a lot lately in theaters.
results.lead_paragraph: ON Friday a time machine will land on the stage of the Abrons Arts Center. The crew -- an astronaut, a squishy space alien and a cyborg with a mustache -- will try to transport audience members to the future, saving them from ''an event so potent it turned this entire planet into a grave.'' Unfortunately this future features endless copulation and meals salvaged from one's own bodily waste. To get there, spectators will first have to survive goofy costumes, low-tech special effects, alien mucus sacs and at least one appalling dance number. ''The Annihilation Point,'' a spoofy piece of lo-fi sci-fi from the Berserker Residents, a Philadelphia company committed to producing fantastical shows, is the latest example in the current surge of science fiction in the theater. Though playwrights as varied as Karel Capek, George Bernard Shaw, Sam Shepard and Caryl Churchill have composed plays in the genre, these scripts are staged rarely, and new ones usually arrive just as infrequently.

headline.main: STATE'S SECRETS: Hidden Hand of Diplomats in Jet Deals

results.snippet: Sales campaigns for commercial jets on the global market often include politicking and cajoling at the highest levels of government.

byline.original: By ERIC LIPTON, NICOLA CLARK and ANDREW W. LEHREN; Eric Lipton reported from Washington, Nicola Clark from Paris and Andrew W. Lehren from New York

results.lead_paragraph: This article was reported by Eric Lipton, Nicola Clark and Andrew W. Lehren and was written by Mr. Lipton. WASHINGTON -- The king of Saudi Arabia wanted the United States to outfit his personal jet with the same high-tech devices as Air Force One. The president of Turkey wanted the Obama administration to let a Turkish astronaut sit in on a NASA space flight. And in Bangladesh, the prime minister pressed the State Department to re-establish landing rights at Kennedy International Airport in New York.

results.abstract: Nearly every first-class stamp design that will be issued by the United States Postal Service in 2011 will bear the word 'forever' in place of a monetary denomination and will remain valid regardless of any price increases; photos (M)

headline.main: Buy These Stamps, and Forget About Rate Increases

results.snippet: This year, nearly every new first-class stamp will bear the word “Forever” in place of a price and will remain valid regardless of any rate increases.
results.lead_paragraph: About 70 new stamp designs that the United States Postal Service plans to issue this year will commemorate familiar themes and subjects: famous people, historic events, America's cultural heritage and holidays. But in a twist, nearly every new first-class stamp will bear the word ''Forever'' in place of a monetary denomination, and will remain valid regardless of any price increases. President Ronald Reagan, former Representative Barbara Jordan, the actor Gregory Peck and the singer Selena are all due to be honored on stamps in 2011, along with the Lunar New Year, the Indianapolis 500, jazz music, American industrial designers and the 150th anniversaries of Kansas' statehood and the outbreak of the Civil War.

results.abstract: Article in series State's Secrets on latest release of American diplomatic cables by WikiLeaks, which reveal role of American diplomacy in winning contracts for commercial jet manufacturer Boeing and thwarting its European competitor Airbus; companies each control about half of global commercial jet market; to greater degree than previously known, diplomats are big part of sales force, according to hundreds of WikiLeaks cables, which describe politicking and cajoling at highest levels; though it is not surprising that United States helps American companies doing business abroad, given that each sale is worth thousands of jobs, these documents, like other WikiLeaks cables, offer remarkably detailed look at what had previously only been glimpsed--in this case, sales war between American diplomats and their European counterparts; photos; graph (M)

results.abstract: New Mexico Gov Susana Martinez scuttles state regulations intended to cut greenhouse gas emissions and the discharge of waste from dairies (M)

headline.main: 2 Environment Rules Halted in New Mexico

results.snippet: The new Republican governor, Susana Martinez, had said the state regulations were burdensome for industry and harmful to the economy.
results.lead_paragraph: Acting on a campaign promise, New Mexico's new Republican governor, Susana Martinez, has scuttled a state regulation requiring annual 3 percent cuts in greenhouse gas emissions. A second environmental rule intended to control the discharge of waste from dairies in southern New Mexico was also dropped before publication. A different state rule that caps greenhouse gas emissions from stationary sources like power plants remains in effect for the time being.

results.abstract: Following the developments after the shooting of Representative Gabrielle Giffords and more than a dozen others in Arizona.

headline.main: Live Blog: Representative Giffords Shot

results.snippet: Following the developments after the shooting of Representative Gabrielle Giffords and more than a dozen others in Arizona.
results.lead_paragraph: Gabrielle Giffords, a congresswoman from Arizona, was shot in the head on Saturday at a public event held at a grocery store in Tucson, her spokesman, C. J. Karamargin, said. A federal judge, John Roll, who had been involved in immigration cases and had received death threats, was among those killed.

headline.main: Giffords: Dem Who Wins in Conservative District

results.snippet: Gabrielle Giffords, one of her state's most high-profile Democrats, seems at first glance to be an unlikely choice of voters in conservative-leaning southern Arizona.
results.lead_paragraph: Gabrielle Giffords, one of her state's most high-profile Democrats, seems at first glance to be an unlikely choice of voters in conservative-leaning southern Arizona.

results.abstract: Rep Gabrielle Giffords and 18 others are shot when gunman Jared Lee Loughner opens fire outside a Tucson, Ariz, supermarket where Giffords is meeting with constituents; six of the victims die, including Judge John M Roll and a nine-year-old girl; authorities suspect that Giffords, who is in critical condition, was the target of the attack; photos; map (M)

headline.main: Congresswoman Is Shot in Rampage Near Tucson

results.snippet: A suspect was in custody and a second was being sought after Representative Gabrielle Giffords was wounded and John M. Roll, a federal judge, was killed.

byline.original: By MARC LACEY and DAVID M. HERSZENHORN; Marc Lacey reported from Tucson, and David M. Herszenhorn from Washington. Carl Hulse, Eric Lipton, Charlie Savage, Scott Shane, Michael Shear, Ashley Southall and Jennifer Steinhauer contributed reporting from Washington, Lisa Button and Joe Sharkey from Tucson and J. David Goodman from New York

results.lead_paragraph: TUCSON -- Representative Gabrielle Giffords, an Arizona Democrat, and 18 others were shot Saturday morning when a gunman opened fire outside a supermarket where Ms. Giffords was meeting with constituents. Six of the victims died, among them John M. Roll, the chief judge for the United States District Court for Arizona, and a 9-year-old girl, the Pima County sheriff, Clarence W. Dupnik, said.

results.abstract: Profile of Rep Gabrielle Giffords of Arizona, who was critically wounded in a shooting spree near Tucson; photos (M)

headline.main: A Passionate Politician and a Friend to Colleagues, Bikers and Lost Mayors

results.snippet: Gabrielle Giffords is widely admired and liked in her state and the nation’s capital for more than her political savvy.
results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON -- Unusual is a relative term in American political life, but Representative Gabrielle Giffords fits the bill: avid equestrian and motorcycle enthusiast, repository of arcane health care data, successful Democrat elected three times in a Republican Congressional district, French horn player and wife of an astronaut. Ms. Giffords, who was shot and critically wounded while meeting with constituents in her district in southern Arizona on Saturday, is widely admired and liked in her state and the nation's capital for more than her political smarts. Friends and associates describe her as the first person to arrange a party for a departing colleague, the one who will walk you across the Capitol complex to make sure you know your way, the person whom even former political opponents call a friend.

headline.seo: Gabrielle Giffords Has Legislative and Family Interest in Space
headline.main: Space Program Runs in Congresswoman’s Family

results.snippet: Representative Giffords of Arizona has supported exploration, not the least because her husband is an astronaut.
results.lead_paragraph: Representative Giffords of Arizona has supported exploration, not the least because her husband is an astronaut.

results.abstract: The latest developments on the shooting in Arizona.

headline.main: Live Blog: Latest Developments on Arizona Shooting

results.snippet: The latest developments on the shooting in Arizona.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and SARAH WHEATON

results.lead_paragraph: Representative Gabrielle Giffords remains in critical condition after being shot in the head at a meet-and-greet in her Tucson-area neighborhood Saturday. Police now say that 20 people in total were shot and that six people were killed in that shooting, including John M. Roll, Arizona's chief federal judge.

results.abstract: Heroism, charity and just plain luck prevailed in 11 minutes between start of Rep Gabrielle Giffords meet-and-greet event and first 911 call to sheriff's office; two men tackled gunman, probably thwarting even greater carnage after Jared L Loughner went on shooting spree in Tucson on Jan 9; map; photos; timeline of events on day of shooting (M)

headline.main: A Single, Terrifying Moment: Shots, a Scuffle, Some Luck

results.snippet: In the Tucson shooting, chance saved some and put others in harm’s way.
results.lead_paragraph: TUCSON -- Patricia Maisch was waiting in line to get a picture with her congresswoman, Gabrielle Giffords, when gunfire erupted. Blood was spilling onto the pavement in an atmosphere of panic and pandemonium. The gunman was walking towards her, shooting people along the way. ''I thought I was next,'' she said. His ammunition spent, the assailant stopped to reload, the authorities said, inserting a 31-round clip into the chamber of his Glock semiautomatic pistol before raising the gun again.

results.abstract: The Quad column; marketing gurus at insurance company Aflac have posed tongue-in-cheek question about BCS National Championship betwwen Oregon and Auburn on whether Aflac duck should side with Oregon Ducks or Auburn Tigers, since company's headquarters are near Auburn campus; other BCS items noted; photo (M)

headline.main: Auburn in Space

results.snippet: Auburn University flags, emblematic nowadays of the football team's quest for a national title, are flapping from front porches and car antennas across Alabama.  Maybe even on the moon.     A set of 10 small blue-and-orange flags accompanied the...
results.lead_paragraph: Auburn University flags, emblematic nowadays of the football team's quest for a national title, are flapping from front porches and car antennas across Alabama. Maybe even on the moon. A set of 10 small blue-and-orange flags accompanied the Auburn graduate Thomas Mattingly, known as T.K., on Apollo 16 nearly 40 years ago. Duties kept him on board while two colleagues went on a crater-strewn walk.

results.abstract: U.S. Navy Captain Mark Kelly says of his wife, the congresswoman, "Gabby was doing what she loved most - hearing from her constituents'' and urges donations to her favorite charities.

headline.main: Congresswoman's Husband Thanks Americans

results.snippet: U.S. Navy Captain Mark Kelly says of his wife, the congresswoman, "Gabby was doing what she loved most - hearing from her constituents'' and urges donations to her favorite charities.
results.lead_paragraph: Mark Kelly, the Navy captain and astronaut whose wife, Representative Gabrielle Giffords, was gravely wounded in an assassination attempt on Saturday, issued a statement thanking Americans for their support and encouraging charitable donations to a local community food bank in Tucson and to the American Red Cross.

headline.seo: ‘The Annihilation Point’ at Abrons Arts Center - Review
headline.print_headline: The End Is Near; Let’s All Exit Laughing
headline.main: The End Is Near; Let’s All Exit Laughing

results.snippet: In “The Annihilation Point,” audience members are tagged with a Reproduction Candidate number and led into a time-travel transit station.
results.lead_paragraph: In “The Annihilation Point,” audience members are tagged with a Reproduction Candidate number and led into a time-travel transit station.

results.abstract: Doctors tending Rep Gabrielle Giffords say that her chances of survival are certain; she is able to breathe on her own, although she reamins on ventilator as precaution; say that what her recovery will look like and how long it will take is unclear; photos (M)

headline.main: Doctors Say Giffords's Condition Points to Survival

results.snippet: Doctors said that Representative Gabrielle Giffords had a “101 percent chance of survival,” but that it was unclear what her recovery would look like.

byline.original: By JENNIFER MEDINA; Reporting was contributed by Lawrence K. Altman and Helene Cooper in Washington and Marc Lacey, Ford Burkhart, Ron Nixon, Lisa Button, Carli Brosseau, Will Ferguson and Clayton Norman in Tucson

results.lead_paragraph: TUCSON -- Just three days after a bullet passed through Representative Gabrielle Giffords's brain, and one day before the president was scheduled to come here to address the shooting rampage in which she was wounded, doctors said Tuesday that Ms. Giffords's chances of survival were certain. She is able to breathe on her own, although she remains on a ventilator as a precaution. What her recovery will look like, however, and how long it will take remain unclear.

results.abstract: David Rooney reviews Tim Sawicki play The Annihilation Point, performed by troupe Berserker Residents under the direction of Dan Rothenberg at the Abrons Arts Center; photo (M)

headline.main: The End Is Near; Let's All Exit Laughing

results.snippet: In “The Annihilation Point,” audience members are tagged with a Reproduction Candidate number and led into a time-travel transit station.
results.lead_paragraph: Delve into the history of many theatermakers, and they are likely to recall staging elaborate fantasy worlds as children. The difference with the Berserker Residents is their refusal to relinquish that unrefined creative spirit. The latest play date with these Philadelphia-based specialists in site-specific overgrown kid theater is ''The Annihilation Point,'' a delightfully goofy humanity-in-peril tale that turns the lower level of the Abrons Arts Center into a time-travel transit station. Audience members are tagged with a Reproduction Candidate number and led through decontamination while a reassuring voice intones, ''In the future, there's nothing to be afraid of.''

results.abstract: Pres Obama offers nation's condolences to victims of Tucson shooting rampage and calls on Americans to draw lesson from lives of fallen and to usher in new era of civility in their honor; confronts political debate that erupted after shooting, urging people of all beliefs not to use tragedy to turn on one another; encourages Americans 'to expand our moral imaginations, to listen to each other more carefully'; he leads overflow crowd at University of Arizona in eulogizing six people who died and asking for prayers for wounded, including Rep Gabrielle Giffords; photos (M)

headline.main: Obama Calls Americans To a New Era of Civility

results.snippet: The president offered the nation’s condolences to the victims of the Tucson shooting rampage, urging Americans to usher in a new era of civility in memory of the fallen.

byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and JEFF ZELENY; Helene Cooper reported from Tucson, and Jeff Zeleny from Washington. David M. Herszenhorn, Janie Lorber and Jennifer Steinhauer contributed reporting from Washington

results.lead_paragraph: TUCSON -- President Obama offered the nation's condolences on Wednesday to the victims of the shootings here, calling on Americans to draw a lesson from the lives of the fallen and the actions of the heroes, and to usher in a new era of civility in their honor. The president directly confronted the political debate that erupted after the rampage, urging people of all beliefs not to use the tragedy to turn on one another. He did not cast blame on Republicans or Democrats, but asked people to ''sharpen our instincts for empathy.''

results.abstract: Doctors see major progress by Rep Gabrielle Giffords in five days since she was shot in Tucson shooting rampage; she is moving her hands and legs, but remains in critical condition; photo (M)

headline.main: Doctors Call Progress a 'Major Leap Forward' as Giffords Moves Legs and Hands

results.snippet: Five days after she was shot in the head, Representative Gabrielle Giffords is able to keep her eyes open for as long as 15 minutes and can move her legs and hands.

byline.original: By MARC LACEY  and TIMOTHY WILLIAMS; Marc Lacey reported from Tucson, and Timothy Williams from New York. Jo Becker, Kirk Johnson, Richard A. Oppel Jr. and Jennifer Medina contributed reporting from Tucson, and John Schwartz from New York

results.lead_paragraph: TUCSON -- Five days after she was shot in the head at close range, Representative Gabrielle Giffords is able to keep her eyes open for as long as 15 minutes and can move her legs and hands, although her right hand has only slight movement, doctors at University Medical Center here said on Thursday. Doctors called her progress ''a major leap forward'' but expressed caution, saying that for now, they would not upgrade Ms. Giffords, an Arizona Democrat, from critical condition. Dr. Peter Rhee, head of trauma at the hospital, said in an interview that the team planned to bring an expert neuro-ophthalmologist and oculoplastic surgeon to help assess the injuries to the bones around Ms. Giffords's eyes. The damage to the area could have damaged her vision, Dr. Rhee said.

headline.main: The Listings

results.snippet: A selected guide to theater performances in New York.
results.lead_paragraph: Theater Approximate running times are in parentheses. Theaters are in Manhattan unless otherwise noted. Full reviews of current shows, additional listings, showtimes and tickets: nytimes.com/theater.

results.abstract: Several of Rep Gabrielle Giffords's friends in Congress visit her in Tucson hospital, where she is recovering from gunshot wound; they include Rep Nancy Pelosi and Sen Kirsten Gillibrand; photo (M)

headline.main: Among Women in Congress, a Bond of Friendship

results.snippet: Colleagues who had become friends with Representative Gabrielle Giffords were at her side as she flicked open an eye.
results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON -- Two arrived at Capitol Hill together, giddy and singled out as women to watch. Another congresswoman was a welcoming face who showed them the ropes in a place where there was not even a ladies' room near the floor where they would vote. Then there was the leader, a mother-hen type who made sure that some of the seats on the Armed Services Committee went to women, including the two new lawmakers. There was political plotting, and vacations by the lake. There was softball. There were double dates with their husbands, most recently with pizza.

results.abstract: Profile of Rep Gabrielle Giffords of Arizona, who is recovering from gunshot wound sustained in Jan 8 attack in Tucson; Giffords has deep roots in Tucson, and diverse city has helped shape her political views; photos (M)

headline.main: For Giffords, Tucson Roots Shaped Views

results.snippet: In Tucson, it is clear how much Gabrielle Giffords’s political views have been shaped by her hometown.

byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG  and WILLIAM YARDLEY; John Schwartz contributed reporting from New York, and Alain Delaquérière contributed research

results.lead_paragraph: TUCSON -- Gabrielle Giffords grew up in an old house filled with old things at the edge of a city being remade by the new. While strip malls and subdivisions were rising everywhere else, her rambling brick residence was surrounded by 18 arid acres of cactuses and mesquite trees and decorated with Mexican art and Southwestern relics. When she gave up her big-city dreams in New York to come home and run her family's tire business, she passed on a new condominium or house in the suburbs, instead moving into an adobe duplex in an old neighborhood with shade trees, where crime might be higher but people knew who lived down the street.

results.abstract: Profile of New York Jets general manager Mike Tannenbaum, who parlayed love of sports, accountant's degree and perseverance bordering on obsession into a career others envy; New England-born Tannenbaum admires Patriots but relishes job of topping them; New York Jets and New England Patriots are preparing to face each other in AFC divisional playoff; photos (M)

headline.main: Son of New England Follows His Binder To Success With Jets

results.snippet: Mike Tannenbaum has long used data analysis and spreadsheets to inform his decision making.
results.lead_paragraph: FLORHAM PARK, N.J. -- The binder that explains Mike Tannenbaum is filled with dozens of pages, with spreadsheets and data analysis and a ''comprehensive report'' of every free agent signed during the 1994 off-season. He compiled it after law school at Tulane, in his spare time, while interning for the New Orleans Saints. He mailed one to every N.F.L. team. The binder is classic Tannenbaum -- dry, smart, focused, filled with numbers.

results.abstract: Philip Galanes Social Q's column on dentists, unrequited love, messy relatives and gifts; drawing (M)

headline.main: Mine's an Astronaut

results.snippet: This week, answers to readers’ questions about friends who brag about their spouses, careless relatives, and other issues.
results.lead_paragraph: Every time my friend mentions that her husband is a doctor, I want to point out that he's a dentist. Would that be petty? Debbie, New York

results.abstract: Condition of Rep Gabrielle Giffords, wounded in Tucson shooting rampage, is upgradged from critical to serious; her husband Mark Kelly says she is 'a fighter;' photos (M)

headline.main: Husband's Message About Giffords: 'She's a Fighter'

results.snippet: Mark Kelly, the husband of Representative Gabrielle Giffords, said she was “improving a little bit each day” as he spoke publicly for the first time since the shootings in Tucson. Her condition was upgraded.

byline.original: By MICHAEL LUO, SAM DOLNICK AND JENNIFER MEDINA; Richard A. Oppel Jr., Joseph Goldstein and Anissa Tanweer contributed reporting

results.lead_paragraph: TUCSON -- On a day when Representative Gabrielle Giffords's condition was upgraded to serious from critical, her husband, Mark Kelly, spoke publicly for the first time on Sunday. He left his wife's hospital bedside to take the stage at a memorial service for Gabriel Zimmerman, an aide who was killed in the shooting rampage that left Ms. Giffords grievously wounded.

results.abstract: The president will honor the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. today and meet with China's president, Hu Jintao, this week.

headline.main: The Early Word: Honoring Dr. King, Anticipating China's President

results.snippet: The president will honor the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. today and meet with China's president, Hu Jintao, this week.
results.lead_paragraph: In The Times:--John Harwood writes about how President Obama's call last week for a country that "lives up to our children's expectations" resonates on this Martin Luther King's Birthday for black children, whose life prospects remain significantly diminished compared with white children's.

results.abstract: Makeshift memorials to victims of Tucson shooting are rising throughout grieving city; proposals emerge for permanent memorials (M)

headline.main: As Tucson Weighs How to Honor the Dead, Many Are Already Doing So

results.snippet: A memorial outside the hospital where Representative Gabrielle Giffords is recovering has become the focal point for grief.

byline.original: By MARC LACEY, JENNIFER MEDINA and DENISE GRADY; Sam Dolnick contributed reporting

results.lead_paragraph: TUCSON -- There are stuffed animals of all possible species and notes written by children in crayon. There are inspiring biblical verses, photographs of the departed and candles summoning a plethora of saints. The somber, sprawling memorial outside University Medical Center has become the focal point for Tucson's grief.

results.abstract: As President Hu Jintao visits the United States this week, China is running a 60-second video on a series of billboard-size screens on Broadway.

headline.main: China's Publicity Ads Arrive in Times Square

results.snippet: As President Hu Jintao visits the United States this week, China is running a 60-second video on a series of billboard-size screens on Broadway.
results.lead_paragraph: China has established an extra large, extra red beachhead in Times Square. In an advertising push the state news agency Xinhua described as a "public diplomacy campaign" that coincides with President Hu Jintao's visit to the United States this week, China is running a 60-second video on a series of billboard-size screens on Broadway. Some of the screens stay red - with Chinese characters in white - while the video is playing on the other screens with images of Chinese celebrities like the martial-arts movie star Jackie Chan; the basketball player Yao Ming; the astronaut Yang Liwei; and the pianists Lang Lang and Yundi. Xinhua said the video would be shown 15 times an hour, 20 hours a day, through Feb. 14, and on CNN through Feb. 13.

results.abstract: Brief video clip from store security camera shows Tucscon shooting rampage suspect Jared L Loughner shooting Rep Gabrielle Giffords and others (M)

headline.main: 5 Seconds of Horror: Video Captured 'Calculated' Gunman in Tucson Attack

results.snippet: Video from a store security camera shows the attack on Representative Gabrielle Giffords and Judge John M. Roll.
results.lead_paragraph: TUCSON -- The chief investigator for the sheriff's department here has for the first time publicly described the brief and gory video clip from a store security camera that shows a gunman not only shooting Representative Gabrielle Giffords just above the eyebrow at a range of three feet, but then using his 9-millimeter pistol to gun down others near her at a similarly close range. The video, according to Richard Kastigar, the investigative and operational bureau chief of the Pima County Sheriff's Department, also reveals that Judge John M. Roll appears to have died while helping to save the life of Ronald Barber, a Giffords employees. Mr. Barber, who was near Ms. Giffords when he was shot twice, has left the hospital.

results.abstract: Gloria Giffords, mother of Tucson shooting rampage victim Rep Gabrielle Giffords, describes remarkable progress by her daughter in exuberant e-mail to family and friends (M)

headline.main: Mother Sees Hopeful Signs For Giffords

results.snippet: Representative Gabrielle Giffords has been looking at photographs and get-well cards, her mother says, though aides cautioned that she faces a difficult recovery.

byline.original: By DENISE GRADY and JENNIFER MEDINA

results.lead_paragraph: TUCSON -- In an exuberant e-mail to family and friends Tuesday, the mother of Representative Gabrielle Giffords described remarkable progress by her daughter. According to the e-mail, Ms. Giffords scrolled through photographs on her husband's iPhone, tried to undo his tie and shirt and even began to look at get-well cards and pages of large-print text taken from a Harry Potter book. ''Everyday Gabby improves and shows higher levels of comprehension and complex actions,'' Ms. Giffords's mother, Gloria, wrote.

headline.main: What's On Today

results.snippet: 8:15 P.M. (Sundance) WOMEN WITHOUT MEN (2009) The visual artist Shirin Neshat is celebrated for her explorations of women's lives in Islamic societies. In this, her directorial debut, she follows four Iranian women from different classes and...
results.lead_paragraph: 8:15 P.M. (Sundance) WOMEN WITHOUT MEN (2009) The visual artist Shirin Neshat is celebrated for her explorations of women's lives in Islamic societies. In this, her directorial debut, she follows four Iranian women from different classes and backgrounds during August 1953, when elements in favor of the monarchy ousted Mohammed Mossadegh and his democratically elected government and restored Shah Mohammed Reza Pahlavi to power, with the help of clandestine support from Britain and the United States. Zarin (Orsi Toth) is an emancipated prostitute who has fled her brothel for refuge at a public bath; Munis (Shabnam Tolouei, above) is a virtual prisoner in the house she shares with her fundamentalist brother, whom the religiously devout Faezeh (Pegah Ferydoni) secretly longs to marry; and Fakhri (Arita Shahrzad), a wealthy 50-year-old, is suffering in an unhappy marriage to a general who reviles her for being menopausal. ''This visually transfixing film, which originated as a video installation, has the feel of an exhibition of Ms. Neshat's work whose figures have stirred to life to play out a tragic feminist allegory,'' Stephen Holden wrote in his review in The New York Times. The film is loosely adapted from a novel by Shahrnush Parsipur, who appears briefly as the bossy madam of the brothel. 8 P.M. (CBS) LIVE TO DANCE While ''American Idol'' welcomes Jennifer Lopez and Steven Tyler to the judges' table on Fox at 8, Paula Abdul reigns over the second semifinal round of this competition series.

results.abstract: The husband of a wounded congressman describes the confusion after her shooting.

headline.main: Giffords's Husband Heard His Wife Had Died in Tucson

results.snippet: The husband of a wounded congressman describes the confusion after her shooting.
results.lead_paragraph: While racing to his wife's side, Mark Kelly, the husband of Rep. Gabrielle Giffords, heard from erroneous television news reports that his wife had been killed when she was shot outside of a Safeway supermarket in Tucson on Jan. 8, he said in a televised interview on Tuesday evening.

headline.main: Kelly Interview Ratings

results.snippet: ABC’s interview with the astronaut Capt. Mark E. Kelly, the husband of Representative Gabrielle Giffords, generated only modest interest in prime time on Tuesday.

byline.original: By BENJAMIN TOFF; Compiled by DAVE ITZKOFF

results.lead_paragraph: ABC's interview with the astronaut Capt. Mark E. Kelly, the husband of Representative Gabrielle Giffords, generated only modest interest in prime time on Tuesday: according to Nielsen's estimates 6.2 million viewers tuned in to the special edition of ''20/20'' at 10 p.m. In contrast, ''The Good Wife'' on CBS led the hour with 11.3 million viewers, and CBS's ''NCIS'' won the night with 21 million at 8. Earlier, excerpts from the interview did provide a boost to ABC's ''World News With Diane Sawyer,'' which attracted an average of 9.1 million viewers, the newscast's largest audience in almost a year. CBS led the night over all, also garnering 17.3 million at 9 for ''NCIS: Los Angeles.'' NBC placed second with ''The Biggest Loser,'' from 8 to 10 (8.2 million), followed by ''Parenthood'' (5.6 million). ABC, in third, averaged 5.7 million at 8 and 9 with ''No Ordinary Family'' and ''V,'' while Fox ranked fourth with a rerun of ''Glee'' at 8 (4.4 million) and ''Million Dollar Money Drop'' at 9 (5.3 million).

results.abstract: Astronaut Timothy Kopra suffers injuries in bicycle crash and will be replaced on space shuttle Discovery's final voyage by Stephen Bowen (S)

headline.main: Florida: Bike Crash Grounds Space-Walking Astronaut

results.snippet: An astronaut who crashed his bicycle over the weekend will not be taking part in space shuttle Discovery's final voyage next month. The astronaut, Timothy Kopra, who suffered unspecified injuries, is on  sick leave. In a rare swap-out Wednesday, NASA...
results.lead_paragraph: An astronaut who crashed his bicycle over the weekend will not be taking part in space shuttle Discovery's final voyage next month. The astronaut, Timothy Kopra, who suffered unspecified injuries, is on sick leave. In a rare swap-out Wednesday, NASA removed him from the crew and added Stephen Bowen, who flew on the shuttle last May.

results.abstract: Rep Gabrielle Giffords is set to transfer TIRR Memorial Hermann rehabilitation hospital in Houston to continue her recovery from shooting in Tucson; hospital is one of top rehabilitation centers in country and specializes in brain and spinal injuries; photo (M)

headline.main: Giffords Set for Transfer to Rehabilitation Center

results.snippet: Representative Gabrielle Giffords, who survived a gunshot through her head on Jan. 8, is likely to leave the intensive care unit of a Tucson hospital on Friday.

byline.original: By JENNIFER MEDINA and MARC LACEY; Marc Lacey contributed reporting

results.lead_paragraph: TUCSON -- Representative Gabrielle Giffords, who survived a gunshot through her head on Jan. 8, is likely to leave a hospital here on Friday and move to the TIRR Memorial Hermann rehabilitation hospital in Houston to continue her recovery, a spokesman for Ms. Giffords said Wednesday. In a sign of her significant progress, Katie Maass, a spokeswoman at University Medical Center, said Ms. Giffords, with the help of medical personnel, left her bed Wednesday and stood by the window of her room. She looked out the window, Ms. Maass said, although doctors have cautioned that they do not yet know the extent of her vision.

results.abstract: Rep Gabrielle Giffords continues to make what doctors say is remarkable progress after being shot in Tucson, but they caution that she still faces months of intensive physical and speech therapy (M)

headline.main: Doctor Cautions That Rehabilitation Process for Giffords Is Likely to Be a Long One

results.snippet: The wounded congresswoman is able to stand without assistance but cannot yet speak, her husband said.

byline.original: By JENNIFER MEDINA; James C. McKinley Jr. contributed reporting from Houston

results.lead_paragraph: TUCSON -- In the nearly two weeks since a gunshot passed through her brain, Representative Gabrielle Giffords has continued to make what doctors say is remarkable progress and is now able to distinguish particular colors and bear her own weight on her feet. But as doctors prepared on Thursday to move her to a rehabilitation center in Houston, they continued to caution that she faces months of intensive physical and speech therapy.

results.abstract: Rep Gabrielle Giffords is transferred by air to Memorial Hermann-Texas Medical Center in Houston to begin what is likely to be a long and arduous rehabilitation from gunshot wound to her head; photos (M)

headline.main: For Giffords, Houston Marks Start of Rehabilitation

results.snippet: Nearly two weeks after a gunshot passed through her brain, Representative Gabrielle Giffords headed to a rehabilitation center in Houston to continue her recovery.

byline.original: By JAMES C. McKINLEY Jr.; Marc Lacey and Sam Dolnick contributed reporting from Tucson

results.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON -- Nearly two weeks after a gunman shot her in the head at an outdoor meeting with voters, Representative Gabrielle Giffords was transferred by air Friday to Memorial Hermann hospital here to begin what is likely to be a long and arduous rehabilitation. The wounded lawmaker, whose against-the-odds fight for survival has inspired people across the country, received a warm farewell from her hometown. Well-wishers lined the streets of Tucson and waved at her ambulance as it went from the hospital to an airport. Some held signs, balloons and flowers. Television helicopters buzzed overhead.

results.abstract: Pres Obama will outline an agenda for 'winning the future' in his State of the Union address, striking a theme of national unity and renewal as he stresses the need for government spending in key areas, particularly job creation, balanced with cutting the budget deficit; message will be geared more broadly toward the political center, toward independent voters who may have been alienated during his first two years in office (M)

headline.main: OBAMA TO PRESS CENTRIST AGENDA IN HIS ADDRESS

results.snippet: President Obama will strike a theme of national unity and renewal in his State of the Union address Tuesday as he stresses the need for both government spending in key areas and an attack on the budget deficit.

byline.original: By JACKIE CALMES and JEFF ZELENY; Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Helene Cooper contributed reporting

results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON -- President Obama will outline an agenda for ''winning the future'' in his State of the Union address on Tuesday night, striking a theme of national unity and renewal as he stresses the need for government spending in key areas and an attack on the budget deficit. Mr. Obama previewed the themes in a video e-mailed Saturday evening to supporters who had helped in his election campaign. But the video made plain that his speech would be geared more broadly toward the political center, to independent voters and business owners and executives alienated by the expansion of government and the partisan legislative fights of the past two years.

results.abstract: Guests will include the intern who aided Representative Gabrielle Giffords and the family of the youngest victim, 9-year-old Christina Taylor Green.

headline.main: For First Lady, Speech Guests From Tucson

results.snippet: Guests will include the intern who aided Representative Gabrielle Giffords and the family of the youngest victim, 9-year-old Christina Taylor Green.
results.lead_paragraph: A number of people who assisted or survive the victims of the Arizona shootings will join Michelle Obama in her gallery box in the House chamber on Tuesday night to watch President Obama deliver the annual State of the Union address.

results.abstract: Clyde Haberman NYC column on New York Jets, whose playoff loss to Pittsburgh Steelers ended their Super Bowl chances; says that name alone does not make Jets a part of New York City; notes that only team that plays in New York is Buffalo Bills (M)

headline.main: With Defeat, No Super Bowl For New Jersey

results.snippet: There will be no Broadway parade for the Jets, along with no need for trash-talking over whether the team belongs to New York or, as reality would suggest, New Jersey.
results.lead_paragraph: Let's look on the bright side. Yes, it is a shame that the Jets will not be headed to the Super Bowl. That is the price they pay for failing to internalize the concept of football as a game to be played in all four quarters, not just the final two. But at least we will be spared more weeks of trans-Hudson nyah-nyahing over whether the team belongs to New York or, as reality would suggest, New Jersey. This is an old dispute, but it has acquired a sharper edge than usual thanks to New Jersey's blunt-speaking governor, Chris Christie. Before the loss to the Pittsburgh Steelers on Sunday, Mr. Christie was more defiant than most of his predecessors about who has claim to a team that defies geography by calling itself the New York Jets.

results.abstract: Two dozen people will join Michelle Obama in House chamber to watch Pres Obama's State of the Union address; list includes three people touched by Tucson shooting rampage; Mark E Kelly, husband of gunshot victim Rep Gabrielle Giffords, declined invitation, saying he will stay by wife's side in Houston; photo (M)

headline.main: Prime Seats Are Filled For Speech To Nation

results.snippet: A number of people who assisted or survive the victims of the Arizona shootings will join Michelle Obama in her gallery box in the House chamber on Tuesday night to watch President Obama deliver the annual State of the Union address.     Robert...
results.lead_paragraph: A number of people who assisted or survive the victims of the Arizona shootings will join Michelle Obama in her gallery box in the House chamber on Tuesday night to watch President Obama deliver the annual State of the Union address. Robert Gibbs, the White House press secretary, said on Monday that seated near the first lady for the joint session of Congress would be Daniel Hernandez, an intern to Representative Gabrielle Giffords whose immediate attention to her brain wound is credited with helping to save her life; members of the family of the youngest victim who died, 9-year-old Christina Taylor Green; and Dr. Peter Rhee, the director of the trauma center at the University of Arizona Medical Center in Tucson, where the casualties were treated.

results.abstract: Officials worry that cuts to National Aeronautics and Space Administration's budget will leave agency without sufficient funding to accomplish any concrete exploratory goals; only remaining function of NASA would be its duty aboard International Space Station, which will be limited after retirement of US space shuttles; photos (M)

headline.main: For NASA, Longest Countdown Awaits

results.snippet: Worries are growing that compromises will leave NASA without enough money to accomplish anything.
results.lead_paragraph: Where to next? And when? For NASA, as it attempts to squeeze a workable human spaceflight program into a tight federal budget, the answers appear to be ''somewhere'' and ''not anytime soon.''

results.abstract: Former Balenciaga studio director Bouchra Jarrar went beyond the veil with a pared-down vision of haute minimalism - that turned out to be a conceptual proposition critics could fully support.

headline.main: Couture Scorecard | Bouchra Jarrar Wins!

results.snippet: Former Balenciaga studio director Bouchra Jarrar went beyond the veil with a pared-down vision of haute minimalism - that turned out to be a conceptual proposition critics could fully support.
results.lead_paragraph: Hooray, couture is back! (And Scorecard doesn't just mean because Christian Lacroix is designing for Desigual.) With daughters of Dubai a calling, Monday John Galliano hauled out the old wasp-waists from the Dior atelier to an 800-seat marquee on the grounds of the Musée Rodin. Meanwhile former Balenciaga studio director Bouchra Jarrar went beyond the veil with a pared-down vision of haute minimalism - that turned out to be a new look critics could fully support.

headline.main: What's On Today

results.snippet: 8 P.M. (HBO2) SILENCING THE SONG: AN AFGHAN FALLEN STAR When  Setara, above, a  singer in her early 20s, was voted off  ''Afghan Star,'' an ''American Idol''-style show that was the subject of an HBO documentary shown last year, cameras caught her...
results.lead_paragraph: 8 P.M. (HBO2) SILENCING THE SONG: AN AFGHAN FALLEN STAR When Setara, above, a singer in her early 20s, was voted off ''Afghan Star,'' an ''American Idol''-style show that was the subject of an HBO documentary shown last year, cameras caught her head scarf slipping -- and her hair revealed -- as she danced across the stage. The incident prompted an uproar in Afghanistan, where Islamic fundamentalists consider certain music sinful. Some traditionalists called for Setara's death, while many young people saw her as a courageous role model willing to challenge restrictions on women's freedom. This sequel from Havana Marking picks up the story six months later, after Setara has abandoned her musical career for marriage and motherhood, while clinging to her independent spirit and fighting for her safety. ''Afghan Star'' leads in at 6:30. 8 P.M. (A&E) DOG THE BOUNTY HUNTER A retrospective of highlights from previous seasons is followed at 9 by the series's 200th episode, in which Dog helps a bondsman whose business could go under if he can't locate his fugitive soon.

results.abstract: TV Watch: Representative Michele Bachmann, Republican of Minnesota, offered a stern rebuttal to the president's speech.

headline.main: TV Watch: Michele Bachmann's Rogue Rebuttal Defies Unity Theme

results.snippet: TV Watch: Representative Michele Bachmann, Republican of Minnesota, offered a stern rebuttal to the president's speech.
results.lead_paragraph: Representative Michele Bachmann, a Tea Party leader, didn't bring a "prom date" to the State of the Union address, she didn't wear the ribbon corsage and she crashed the after-party known as the official Republican response. When Ms. Bachmann, Republican of Minnesota, addressed the nation with her own, more alarmist assessment of its state, she seemed almost like the telekinetic high school heroine of "Carrie."

results.abstract: Capt Mark E Kelly must decide whether he is able to go ahead with his scheduled mission to the International Space Station on the shuttle Endeavour while his wife, Rep Gabrielle Giffords, undgergoes her long and arduous rehabilitation after being shot; photos (M)

headline.main: For an Astronaut And a Husband, Tough Choice Ahead

results.snippet: Gabrielle Giffords’s husband must decide whether to move ahead with commanding the space shuttle in April.
results.lead_paragraph: As Representative Gabrielle Giffords settles into a rehabilitation hospital in Houston, a major question remains for her husband, the astronaut Mark E. Kelly: Will he fly or not? Captain Kelly, a Navy officer who flew 39 combat missions in the Persian Gulf war, is scheduled to fly the shuttle Endeavour on a two-week mission to the International Space Station in April.

headline.main: Inside The Times

results.snippet: International     AFGHANS TO STOP RECRUITING
results.lead_paragraph: International AFGHANS TO STOP RECRUITING
